title: Är du Centrics nya 3rd line supporttekniker?
description:
Till uppdrag hos flera av våra kunder i Stockholmsområdet söker vi nu efter erfarna 2nd line tekniker som nyligen tagit nästa steg i karriären och idag arbetar inom 3rd line support. Vi söker efter dig som till vardags trivs med avancerad problemlösning i Windowmiljö och som vill fortsätta din IT-karriär hos oss på Centric.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som 3rd line supporttekniker är du användarnas och dina kollegors räddare i nöden! Du tar emot ärenden som eskalerats i organisationen, från 1st och 2nd line. Med detta sagt kommer du förmodligen stöta på nya, spännande och komplexa ärenden varje dag. Det kan exempelvis röra sig om nätverksrelaterade problem och systemfel i kundspecifika miljöer. Du kommer arbeta med teknisk support i Windowsmiljö samt arbeta med felsökning, förvaltning och enklare drift av Windows Servrar.
 



  





 I och med att arbetsuppgifterna är varierande beroende på hos vilken kund du hamnar så kan det även innefatta hantering av virtuella maskiner, så som VMware och HyperV.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 För att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att du är en person som drivs och motiveras av utveckling! Att arbeta strukturerat och lösningsorienterat är ditt ledord. Du ser övergripande på komplexa problem och med hjälp av ditt analytiska tänkande har du förmågan att kunna isolera orsaker, utveckla och använda metoder som tar dig vidare i din felsökning. Du komminucerar mycket väl på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift. Vidare är du en flexibel person som uppskattar teamarbete likväl som du själv tar ansvar och driver fram lösningar hela vägen till mål!
 



  





*Krav* 



* 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom support
* Relevant utbildning inom IT
* Erfarenhet av felsökning och förvaltning av Windows Server
* Paketering av applikationer i SCCM
* Felsökning av nätverk
* Djup kunskap i Microsoft365
* Azure/Intune



  





*Meriterande* 



* Linux
* Hantering av virtuella maskiner, HyperV / VMware
* Administration av databaser



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande och roliga aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under trevliga och avslappnande former.
 



  





*Mer om oss* 




 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, och med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Linköping och Örebro. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Presales Specialist SaaS Security & Compliance (NL or Sweden)
description:
**Job Description**
 Do you want to work for a leading Cloud company and thrive in a team environment? Are you a quick-thinking, problem solver with a passion for cybersecurity/SaaS security, cloud operations, data privacy or compliance? If you have sharp independent judgement, and an approach to sales we want to hear from you. At Oracle, we believe that the companies that will thrive in this new world of digital disruption will be those who embrace cloud computing and SaaS applications as a way to accelerate operations, engage with customers more intimately, find and dazzle great talent, and become the positive disruptors.
   

  

 What we will offer you
   

  

* Join a global workplace where you can make an impact.
* We offer competitive salaries and exciting benefits – along with flexible and remote working to suit your lifestyle.
* Get access to development opportunities that can advance your career, an Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health, and core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning.
* Work in a multi-cultural environment and international team.
* Continuous training and development opportunities.
* Work with a highly regulated customers in many different countries.


 What you will doThe EMEA SaaS Security and Privacy team is a specialist team supporting sales within EMEA applicationsbusiness. The team specializes in; how we run the Public Cloud, Cloud Security, how Oracle meets Privacy and Regulator obligations. These topics are at the forefront of customers/prospects agenda and are key areas of differentiation for Oracle in Cloud. This Senior role will be within the EMEA SaaS Security & Privacy Team supporting the Oracle SaaS applications business, covering all SaaS applications from ERP, HCM, CX. The successful applicant will be a maker with passion for Cybersecurity and Compliance, being able to successfully present these topics in a sales-oriented manner to Oracle’s SaaS prospects during the sales cycle and create confidence with customers, removing any customer barrier to move to Oracle cloud.The candidate will also be able to create internal sales awareness and education on SaaS Security & Compliance topics, but equally in industry events and trade shows. Duties and tasks:
   

  

* Act as independent subject matter expert on cybersecurity, compliance, and SaaS operations in the allocated Region.
* Engage and build relationships with customer prospects, account executives, sales leaders, and pre-sales teams within region.
* Deliver articulate, effective, and audience-appropriate pre-sales presentations / workshops with technically oriented content in the area of expertise (cybersecurity, cloud operations and compliance) at various events/meeting to both small and large audiences from C-Suite down.
* Provide internal and external advocacy on cybersecurity, cloud operations and compliance.
* Convey a compelling and convincing case for Oracle Cloud technologies vs. the competition.
* Ability to deliver complex technical security and cloud operations workshops.
* Maintain deep knowledge around cybersecurity, SaaS operations and regulatory compliance frameworks.
* Assist in RFP and tenders within your region were deemed necessary.
* Assist legal and commercial teams in contract negotiations.
* Facilitating and nurturing senior management relationships to generate active sponsorship of Oracle.
* Maintaining an understanding customer security and compliance needs to influence Oracle roadmap.
* Maintaining a complete and up-to-date understanding of competition.On top, you will:
* Maintain regular contact with Product Managers and other stakeholders to share customer needs.
* Work with appropriate people to co-ordinate marketing activities and internal & external events.
* Enable and create awareness about cybersecurity, SaaS operations and compliance to the sales community.
* Attend to relevant industry/subject forums for competence building.Qualifications needed:
* At least 10 years of experience in cybersecurity or compliance topics.
* Fluent English with Dutch or Swedish business proficiency is required.
* Presales role: Technical background is required but deep hands-on experience is not required.
* Preferably technical bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
* Either CISSP, CCSK, CIPP/T, CIPP/E Certified or any other relevant security / compliance certifications.
* Sales Orientated and able to work with an important level of independence in the country / region.
* Proactive and self-starter.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong presentation skills.
* Adept at driving two ways communication by clearly articulating value proposition and teaching to customer’s difficulties
* Ability to adapt to a constantly evolving, progressive organization.
* Ability to work independently and with a team, and in an efficient and organized manner.


 Does this sound like you? If so, we hope to meet you!
   

  

 At Oracle, we don’t just respect differences - we celebrate them. We believe that innovation starts with inclusion, and that to create the future, we need people with a diverse set of backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can do their best work. When everyone’s voice is heard and valued, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/
   

  

 Life at Oracle and Equal OpportunityAn Oracle career can span industries, roles, Countries and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.Oracle offers a highly competitive suite of Employee Benefits designed on the principles of parity, consistency, and affordability. The overall package includes certain core elements such as Medical, Life Insurance, access to Retirement Planning, and much more. We also encourage our employees to engage in the culture of giving back to the communities where we live and do business.We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to successfully participate in the job application, interview process, and in potential roles to perform crucial job functions.That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.Disclaimer: Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer
   

  

 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**ABOUT US**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

title: Sales & Support Bygg - Clas Fixare
description:
**Sales & Support - Clas Fixare AB, Stockholm**
 Clas Fixare brinner för att förenkla vardagen i varje hem genom att erbjuda små och stora hantverkstjänster till privat-och företagskunder över hela Sverige. Vi är ett 100% helägt dotterbolag till Clas Ohlson med en tydlig vision: att skapa ett schysst och modernt hantverksbolag med engagerade kollegor och nöjda kunder.
   

  

**Nu söker vi en kollega till vår avdelning Sales & Support.**
 Trivs du i ett varierande arbete med många kontaktytor samt med service och försäljning som inslag kan det här vara en rolig och utmanande tjänst för dig!
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som gärna ska tillsättas omgående, på Clas Fixare tillämpar vi alltid en provanställning på sex månader.
   

  

 Tjänsten är på plats i centrala Stockholm med möjlighet att jobba remote enstaka dagar vid behov.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
 Din uppgift är att stötta Clas Fixares kunder och hantverkare vid offerering, koordinering samt eftermarknadshantering av våra tjänster. En del av tjänsten handlar om att säkra upp merförsäljning, både i kundbokningssamtal och i utåtriktade aktiviteter till potentiella kunder.
   

  

**Vi Erbjuder**
* Anställning i ett företag som vill bygga branschens bästa hantverksbolag.
* Ett roligt arbete där din kompetens inom service och försäljning blir väldigt viktig.
* En härlig arbetsmiljö och ett gäng glada, professionella och fartfyllda medarbetare.
* En platt organisation där medarbetare och kunder är i fokus.
* Afterwork och andra sociala aktiviteter.


**Den Vi Söker**
 Du har lätt för att kommunicera med kunder och kollegor, du brinner för att ge god service samt har lätt för att sälja in företagets tjänster. Du är duktigt på att vara spindeln i nätet och trivs med att ha många processer igång. Samtidigt förstår du att kunden står i centrum och inser att varje kund har unika behov.
   

  

 Du vågar fråga kunderna efter ytterligare information när det behövs och du är duktig på att förklara vilka förutsättningar som måste finnas för att tjänsten ska kunna genomföras med högsta kvalitet.
   

  

 Att ta initiativ är inte främmande för dig och du kommer gärna med förslag på lösningar kring hur vi kan förbättra både verksamheten och kundmötet.
   

  

**Erfarenhet Och Kompetens**
* Du trivs i en föränderlig arbetsmiljö med ett högt inflöde av information.
* Du har tidigare arbetet med offerter och försäljning.
* Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
* Du är effektiv och strukturerad som person och får mycket gjort.
* Du har erfarenhet av kundsupport, rådgivning och koordinering.
* Du har erfarenhet av och trivs med att jobba med försäljning.
* Du har minst tre års kundrelaterad arbetslivserfarenhet med goda vitsord.
* Du har god IT-vana.
* Du kommer att arbeta med vår bygg och monterings-avdelning och vi ser gärna att vår nya kollega har erfarenhet inom bygg.


**Ansökan**
 Tjänsten ska tillsättas så snart som möjligt. Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan ansökningstiden gått ut - skicka din ansökan redan idag.
   

  

 Har du frågor gällande tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta områdesansvarig Pierre Dahlgren; pierre.dahlgren@clasfixare.se
   

  

 Vi hanterar inga ansökningar via brev eller e-post. Alla ansökningar till Clas Fixare hanteras konfidentiellt. Genom att ansöka samtycker du till att Clas Fixare AB får nyttja dina personuppgifter i syfte att genomföra rekryteringsarbetet kopplat till detta rekryteringsärende i enlighet med Dataskyddsförordningen (GDPR). Personuppgifter sparas i upp till 24 månader.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Clas Ohlson grundades 1918 som en postorderfirma i Insjön, Dalarna. Idag är vi ett detaljhandelsbolag med kunder i Sverige, Norge och Finland.
   

  

 Mycket har hänt sedan starten, men en sak har varit densamma genom alla år: att vi vill hjälpa människor att fixa sina hem med praktiska och hållbara lösningar till attraktiva priser.

title: MSc Student
company: Hiven Energy | Build smart energy apps
description:
THESIS - Optimal bidding of a fleet of electrical-vehicle chargers in the mFRR activation market
 



 Perm/Temp: Temporary
 



 Sth Solna, SE
 



  





 Background
 



 The growth of intermittent renewable power productions calls for a higher level of flexibility in the power grid. At the same time, the number of Electric Vehicles (EVs) has been steadily increasing in the past years. The EVs are seen as a source of flexibility that not only helps grid stability, but also generates an additional revenue for EV owners.
 







 Manual Frequency Restoration Reserve (mFRR ) is one type of ancillary grid services. This reserve is activated by the TSO (transmission system operator) on an hourly basis in response to power system energy needs, ensuring that power supply and demand is always balanced. The TSO procures the energy needs through an auction that takes place every hour, 45 minutes before delivery hour. Every market participant submits a bid curve detailing the energy they are willing to provide for a given clearing price. If a bid is accepted by the TSO, then the participant is obliged to deliver the procured volume and is reimbursed by the clearing price of the auction.
 







 The bid curve submitted to the mFRR market should maximize the expected revenue, yet at the same time it should respect constraints imposed by the charger availability and user preferences (such as ready time, target state-of-charge). These aspects, in addition to uncertainty associated to the EV behaviors, make the bidding problem of EV chargers for grid services different from conventional power plants.
 







 Objective
 



 The thesis project involves the following work:
 



 -Conduct literature study to check for prior works related to optimal bidding of EV chargers, particularly for the mFRR market.
 



 -Analyze historical mFRR price data and fit a stochastic price model
 



 -Develop and validate a method computing the optimal bid, considering prices, charger availability, TSO requirements, etc..
 



 -Evaluate the impact of different source of uncertainties (EV chargers behavior, market prices,..).
 







 Your Qualifications
 



 -Good programming skills (ideally in Python).
 



 -Any course in mathematical optimization (LP, MILP,...), machine learning, statistics or quantitative finance is an advantage.
 



 -Interest into energy markets, optimization and data science topics.
 



 -The project language is English, hence good communication in English is required.
 







 We offer you
 



 -An expert will be appointed to supervise and guide you through the thesis project.
 



 -You have the opportunity to create a network of people within the company as well as with other students doing their thesis with us.
 



 -An interesting thesis, that can lead to a career with us.
 



 -Fortum offers a taxable one-time compensation for a well-executed and approved thesis.
 







 Interested?
 



 To apply, register your CV and a personal letter of maximum one page or a Power Point presentation of maximum two slides, in our Recruitment Tool, latest by 24th November 2024. https://jobs.fortum.com/Fortum/job/Sth-Solna-THESIS-Optimal-bidding-of-a-fleet-of-electrical-vehicle-chargers-in-the-mFRR-activation-market/994057255/
 



 Applications will be evaluated continuously and an applicant may be on-boarded before this date.

title: Part-time Student Assistant to Normative!

Are you a student studying to become an engineer and have an eye for details? Do you also have knowledge in Microsoft Office and experience working with information-rich data? Then you might be the right person for this job! In this position you will work at a company that strives to create a more sustainable future for us and our planet.
   




 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Normative AB
 



  

**City :**
 Södermalm, Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Part time, flexible hours
 



  

**Start date :**
 1st November
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
 



  

**Other :**
 Grönt jobb
   




**About the role**

 Normative has developed the world’s first emission accounting engine. They help companies calculate their climate footprint and provide insights to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions. Their work helps clients become more aware of their role in contributing to a better world, and therefore, being part of the Normative team means that you will contribute to a net-zero world.
 


  


 In this position, you will be part of a team that works with calculations and processes data. You will mainly work with large amounts of data which require a strong eye for detail. You will also co-operate and communicate with colleagues in your team as well as within the organization as a whole.
 


  


 This is a part-time position where you will work a maximum of 10 hours/week. When the reporting season comes during february until may the work load maybe increase and you will work more than this. You can work remotely but should have the possibility to come to the office in Södermalm.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* Valuable knowledge and experience within the sustainability field
  
* Normative having a remote-first culture, the hours are very flexible
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Find company information and categorize the company
  
* Format excel-files
  
* Look into suppliers, update and enhance the database with relevant data points
  
* Calculate carbon emissions
  

  


**We are looking for**

 As a Student Assistant you are meticulous, structured and have an endurance in working with detailed data for the most of your working day. To be successful in this role we are now looking for someone who:
 


  

  
* Is currently studying to be an engineer within a relevant field and have at
   

**least one year left on the studies**
  
* Has experience in working with Excel
  
* Has very good knowledge in English, both written and speaking
   

  

**It is meritorious if you**
  
* Are passionate about the climate and want to work for a better planet
  
* Studying sustainability, data or similar
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Structured
  
* Flexible
  
* Results-oriented
  
* Communicative
  


  


  

**In order to both succeed and thrive in the role,**
 we believe that you are a person who has a good ability to act flexibly and have the ability to work with others. You are unpretentious and motivated by the possibility to take ownership of your work to make sure you drive them forward from start-goal. Finally, we believe that you are a person who is thorough and likes to get involved with detailed information where great accuracy is required.
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Normative AB**

 Normative helps companies calculate their climate footprint and provide insights to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions. Normative was born in 2014 to help humanity achieve net zero emissions. Today, their emission accounting engine uses more than 200,000,000 data points when calculating a company’s emissions. Customers from around the world trust Normative as an essential piece in reducing their carbon footprint. They have accounted for more than 38,000,000 tons of CO2, equivalent to over 475,000,000 laptops.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Linnea Molnar or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv5@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15107904

title: Senior Data Engineer - Stockholm
description:
**Join the planet’s most important fight!**
**Normative is now looking for a Senior Data Engineer in Stockholm.**
 At Normative, we're on a mission to accelerate the transition to a net-zero world. We provide science-based carbon accounting software and tailored advice from net-zero experts, empowering companies to reduce their carbon footprints.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a passionate and curious Senior Data Engineer to play a key role in architecting the data-driven foundation at Normative. As part of our dynamic R&D team, you will be the primary contact for designing, building, and managing the data analytics infrastructure necessary for generating valuable insights.
   

  

 This includes building dashboards, generating actionable insights, building out our data analytical infrastructure, and ensuring organizations can efficiently measure and understand their emissions. Without context, data is just numbers – you help us transform data into the sustainability intelligence needed to achieve net zero.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Design, build, and manage the foundation of the analytics data platform at Normative.
* Collaborate with Product teams, DevOps engineers, and Data Scientists to address Normative’s data challenges.
* Drive the development of internal tools related to data analytics and data quality.
* Develop efficient and reliable data pipelines.
* Share your knowledge of data best practices and learn alongside your colleagues.


**This role is for you if**
* You are motivated to be part of a team working against climate change.
* You have experience in a similar role – as a Data Engineer, Data Scientist, or Software Engineer – and have expertise in designing, building, and maintaining cloud-based data infrastructure.
* You have utilized modern analytics tools such as Snowflake or BigQuery for warehousing, Airflow or DBT for orchestration, and Looker or Tableau for visualization.
* You are proficient in using the Python data stack and SQL for analytics.
* You enjoy exploring new datasets and using your data analytics and visualization skills to explore and explain.


**We Also Believe You Are**
* Someone who is committed to making a meaningful contribution towards a sustainable future.
* Comfortable working in an environment with the typical challenges of a growing company, asking questions, and learning new things.


 We also believe you enjoy working in an environment with typical challenges of a growing company, asking a lot of questions and learning new things. At Normative we believe that collaboration with teammates is essential and you’ll thrive if you like to explain and discuss technical approaches with other engineers.
   

  

 If you are a driven and passionate individual with a strong desire to make a positive impact on the world, and a real love for Engineering, we encourage you to apply. This is an exciting opportunity to join a mission-driven company and make a real difference in the fight against climate change.
   

  

 Join us and be a part of something bigger than yourself. Together, we can create a more sustainable future for all.
   

  

*Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? Apply anyway!*
**Location**
 Normative operates on a hybrid remote model with offices in Stockholm, Copenhagen, and London. For this role you will be located in our wonderful HQ in Stockholm or remotely in Sweden.
   

  

*At this time we are not able to offer relocation or VISA support for this position.*
**Benefits**
* Market-based salaries and annual merit-based salary reviews
* 30 days/year of paid vacation + up to 2 additional days off
* Pension and parental leave
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag) + 1 wellness hour per week
* Social and team-building activities (off-site, after work, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact on the world
* A friendly, supportive and humble working culture


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
**How To Apply**
 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

**Our Interview Process Consists Of 4 Stages**
* Screening interview with a member of our Talent Acquisition team
* First interview with the hiring manager


*Online Personality & Logic assessment*
* Technical interview with members of the Engineering team
* Final Interview


 We’re committed to hiring diversely. Having employees from diverse backgrounds brings a wealth of perspectives and experience to our team. We assess candidates based on their experience, skills and unique talents and evaluate everyone against the same criteria.
   

  

*Normative handles sensitive financial data and we will therefore conduct a background check before hiring any candidate.*

title: Postdoctoral Researcher
description:
Several challenges remain before larger scale deployment of Autonomous vehicles (AVs). This postdoc project, part of a Swedish national research project, is investigating how DevOps practices can be adapted to support safety critical systems and specifically automated vehicles (AVs). The need to update AVs is driven commercially and by evolving security threats but becomes especially important due to the open environments in which AVs operate. This requires monitoring actual operations and to be able to decide on and perform required updates, while ensuring that such updates and new behaviors do not jeopardize safety. The project addresses the gap between the tradition of DevOps, which is not addressing safety-critical systems, and the tradition of safety-critical systems, which does not address DevOps.
 



  





 The postdoc position represents a unique opportunity to do research on trustworthy DevOps for AVs. The postdoc is expected to contribute to collaborative research (including with other academic researchers and our industrial partners). There will also be excellent opportunities for experimental evaluation and case studies, something we believe is important. You are welcome to contribute to relevant educational efforts, especially in formulating and supervising project-related MSc thesis projects and supervision of involved PhD students. Other teaching engagements would also be possible depending on your interests.
 



  





 As a candidate, we believe that you have a strong basis in software engineering but also other backgrounds and competences can be relevant for the position. We are open to different profiles and directions for the position as outlined in a very recent position paper.
 



  





**Read more about the position, what we offer and qualitifications here:** 
 https://www.kth.se/lediga-jobb/757971?l=en
 



  





 Learn from a recent position paper here: http://tiny.cc/kg5nzz

title: Team Lead- Engineering
description:

 You will be joining our Tickstar team. The Tickstar team is responsible for providing e-invoicing infrastructure and services to customers around the world. + Ensure the health of all the teamʼs products is well understood by the team, discoverable by the wider organization, and able to be addressed, should problems occur.

**What you'll bring with you**

+ Excellent grasp of modern software delivery practices and life cycle.
+ Proven ability to balance the needs of the individual with the needs of the business.
+ Experience with coaching and mentoring.

+ Extensive experience developing infrastructure applications.
+ Experience with our tech stack Java, AWS, PostgresSQL

title: VP Revenue Operations
description:
Our vision is to transform presentations, meetings and lectures by turning passive audiences into engaged contributors. We make this possible through our interactive presentation platform where the traditional presentation monologue becomes an inclusive dialogue. We believe in the power of together and that the most successful leaders listen to be heard.
   

  

 With Mentimeter, users become the best presenter they can be. Meetings become more productive, participants learn more and have fun whilst doing it.
   

  

 We have more than 300 million users and customers worldwide, on our way of making the world a better place, one presentation at a time.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for a commercially focused
 **VP of Revenue Operations** 
 to operationalize revenue strategies across our customer journey. This role is new at Mentimeter and will be crucial in further enhancing our revenue generating capabilities and ensuring a cohesive approach to driving revenue across the customer journey. We have a product-led growth go-to-market and our revenue comes from both self-service customers & enterprise customers. You will work with areas such as refining & streamlining operational workflows, identifying gaps in our understanding of operational performance & defining analysis to-be-done as well as ensuring alignment across commercial departments.
   

  

 You will report to the COO in a central department but working closely with catalysing revenue leaders in our commercial departments (sales, marketing & product). You will be responsible for leading & supporting a team consisting of our Sales Operations Director, Martech & Operations Director & Product Growth Lead which all work embedded in our commercial departments. The total extended teams working with the Revenue Operations area is roughly 10-15 people.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Strategic direction of Revenue Operations: Together with our CSO, CPO and CMO set the 3 year strategic agenda for how the Revenue Operations area will contribute to Mentimeter’s success
* Operationalization of revenue strategies: Responsible for the overview and refinement of end-to-end revenue processes, identifying gaps in our workflows across the customer journey as well as identifying new revenue operations enabled commercial opportunities
* Strategic Alignment: Align initiatives, approaches and definitions across departments to ensure a cohesive approach to driving revenue across the customer journey
* Facilitate data enabled commercial teams: Collaborate with our VP of Data & Analytics to leverage data to empower our commercial teams. Be the commercial counterpart for e.g. data activation & data collection. Support operational analysis & forecasting, identify gaps in our understanding of operational performance as well as defining analysis to-be-done and predictive data models needed.
* Support alignment of priorities: Facilitate joint goal setting & alignment of priorities across departments. Own and develop our central planning process to ensure cross-functional resource allocation for efficient execution
* Technology and tooling: Own the vision for the tech & tooling needed to manage and optimise the end-to-end revenue process - including adoption of new technology such as generative AI. Accountable for selection, implementation and management of tools that support the revenue-generating functions e.g. CRM systems, automation tools, and other tools that facilitate effective commercial operations.
* People engagement, performance & retention for the RevOps teams: Responsible for the employee engagement, performance & retention in the Revenue Operations teams


**We Believe You Have**
* 10+ years relevant experience, whereof at least 6 years leadership experience
* Proven experience of being responsible for Revenue Operations in a fast-paced SaaS environment
* A proven track record of revenue growth attributed to your work
* A solid understanding of all parts of Revenue Operations (from strategy to tooling to organisational alignment)
* Strong execution skills with a love for getting things done - you know how to transform a strategic directions to successful Revenue Operations
* Strong leadership skills and a track record of successfully coaching other leaders
* Strong collaboration and stakeholder management skills (you will be collaborating with many different functions and people)
* Strong analytical skills with a proven ability to define analysis to-be-done
* Deep knowledge in Salesforce CRM and preferably also experience from marketing automation platforms, eg. Braze or similar


**It’s a Bonus If You Have**
* Experience from working with Revenue Operations in a product lead growth & sales motion
* Have worked in a scale up environment at a company of a similar size
* Have earlier experience of reporting directly to someone in the management team


 Please note that this role will have its base in our
 **Stockholm** 
**office** 
 and is primarily an onsite role with the opportunity to work from home twice per week.
   

  

 Click here to learn more about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
* Introduction interview - Meet TA rep and/or hiring manager for introduction interviews
* Business Case - Conduct a business case showcasing your operational & strategic skills, knowledge and core competencies
* Competence interview - Meet the team for an onsite deep dive interview
* Alva Labs tests - conduct a personality and logical ability test as part of the screening process
* Culture & Leadership interview - Reflect more about our 5 core values and why you would be a great fit at Mentimeter


**Apply today and join the team at Mentimeter!**
 At Mentimeter where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Once a year we also relocate to exciting places all over the world like Merida & Buenos Aires for our Toronto colleagues, cities in Europe (for our Stockholm colleagues), and cities in APAC (for our Sydney colleagues), paid for by us of course. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page .
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Senior ML Engineer - AI Services
description:
Schibsted Media is a family of well-known media brands across Norway, Sweden and Finland. Our winning ambition is to be the leading media destination in Nordics. To reach our ambition we strive to offer the best and most relevant products in the media industry, making it even more attractive for readers, listeners, viewers, and advertisers to engage with our universe.
   

  

 Data and AI is the central organisation within Schibsted Media that is responsible for its data platform, and builds data and AI products with emphasis on volume, velocity and privacy that serve the whole of Schibsted Media and its brands.
   

  

 AI Services is a team within Data&AI that is currently responsible for developing and maintaining machine learning models that are empowering many use cases in Schibsted such as: producing insights and analytics about our customers, segments for the online advertising on our sites and personalization of news. We are working with big amounts of data from newspapers (like VG, Aftenposten, Aftonbladet, Bergens Tidene) and we are also looking for new ways to enhance user experience by adding new capabilities to our portfolio, which include working with content data and other exciting opportunities.
   

  

**We are looking for an experienced ML Engineer** 
 , who is independent, goal oriented and loves working with Big Data. We practise a product-oriented mindset, so you will be working alongside the product management team to find the best solutions to meet the needs of our internal stakeholders.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Contribute to analysis, design, building, training, evaluation, shipping and refinement of ML-driven products to solve real-world problems
* Collaborate closely with a cross-functional agile team spanning data science, product management, and engineering to build prototypes as well as production-ready solutions
* Engage with internal stakeholders and end-users to better understand their needs, as well as explain, educate, and support them in ML matters
* Provide guidance to more junior team members


**What is our technology stack?**
* Data Processing: Luigi/Spark/Scala -> Flyte/PySpark/Python. We are currently in the process of migration, consider the latter to be the future, however you might be required to work with some of the older pipelines before they are migrated
* Machine Learning: Tensorflow, Pytorch
* Infrastructure: Docker, Kubernetes as a main platform for both processing and services, AWS as cloud provider (S3, EKS)


**Job Requirements**
* You have at least a Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or any quantitative field
* 3+ years of related industry experience in the data science domain and a deep understanding of AI and machine learning methods and algorithms
* You have great communication skills, can communicate complex concepts in a simple way, and articulate solutions to other team members and non-technical people
* Solid knowledge of Python with the ability to write performant production-quality code, other programming languages are a bonus
* Experience working with Pandas, Transformers and Tensorflow/Keras or Pytorch
* Experience working with Spark, Databricks or other big data technologies
* Experience working with Kubernetes and AWS (or any other cloud provider)


 As a part of Schibsted, you will also have the opportunity to share knowledge and learn from other data engineers across the organisation. We encourage a diverse, collaborative and creative work environment, where you will develop and push for state-of-the-art solutions in big data processing as well as building reliable and highly scalable services.

title: System Test Engineer Automotive domain
description:
**Company Description**
 Join the world of the future in a fast-growing international company! Be at the heart of innovation and create innovative human-centric technology with other engineers around the world. When joining SEGULA you will be joining a high skilled network of engineer and we are looking for you who wants to be a part of a company that provides you with different interesting assignments where you can utilize your technology skills in the best way possible.
   

  

 With our presence in 30 countries and 140 locations worldwide we boost competitiveness within all of the major industrial sectors: automotive, aerospace, energy, rail, naval and life sciences.
   

  

 We offer you a dynamic working environment, a team that is dedicated to your professional growth and your overall well-being in your day-to-day job. As a company, our passion and goal is to make people and organizations grow.
   

  

 #LetsShapeTheFutureTogether
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you interested in joining a team that works on the vehicles of tomorrow? When joining this team, you will be a part of a team that supports our client in testing the features of our future vehicles. Your main role in this position would be to perform system tests in Python. The team you will be joining is working with the gearbox, transmission systems and clutch control.
   

  

**Your Main Task Is**
* Define test cases for System & SW safety requirements (SIL, HIL) using Python


**Other Tasks May Include**
* Call for kickoff & retrospective meetings
* Prepare the test environment: ensure the time booking for the HIL, collaborate with model team to fix all issues related to HIL
* Execute and Analyze test case
* Ensure deliverables quality
* Report the discrepancies found during the test of the system
* Maintain traceability & verify the resolution of software defects


**Skills And Tools You Will Use**
 Etas INCA Python, Polarion, JIRA, GitLab, Functional Safety
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Experience of system testing (developing test cases, test scripts) in embedded systems
* Experience of requirement review, analysis, and developing test cases from requirements as well as HARAs, FMEAs
* Experience of blackbox testing and various test methods such as requirement based, interface, fault injection, boundary value, etc
* Experience/knowledge of various levels of testingPython, C, C++, CAPL Software testing automation framework, Robot framework, Linux, RTOS BareMetal (any of the mentioned)
* Experience with software in loop (SIL) and hardware in loop (HIL) testing Git, Jira, Jenkins


**Meritious**
* Experience or knowledge in functional safety standards is a plus (ISO26262)
* Experience or knowledge in ISO21434 is highly meritorious
* Swedish language skills (spoken and written)


**Who are you?**
 As a person, you are responsible, structured and proactive, and encouraged by technical challenges. You can quickly familiarize yourself with advanced problems with a desire to find creative solutions together with your colleagues. You have an eye for quality and strive to ensure customer quality and satisfaction.
   

  

**Additional Information**
**Our offer**
 When working as a consultant at Segula, you get a secure employment and a dynamic work environment. You become a part of a group nice colleagues who takes care of each other. To make sure you get to know your colleagues, we meet for different activities and events.
   

  

 We also offer
   

  

* Secure employment and working conditions according to Swedish labor laws
* Competitive salary and benefit package
* Work with a collection of Segulas esteemed clients, leading companies in their field
* The chance to utilize your skill set to make real impact for the future of movement while having a dedicated consultancy company as your support
* Be a part of a growing network of skilled engineers
* Close relationship with your manager who supports you in your career development


 To thrive in this role we believe that you enjoy working collaboratively and that you are proactive in taking initiative. To apply for this position, you need to have a valid work VISA within the European Union. We embrace diversity and equality and attach great importance to your personal qualities. We are continuesly recruiting, so welcome with you application today!
   

  

 For questions or further information, please contact talia.brorsson@segulagrp.com

title: System Test Engineer to Life-Science start-up
description:
Here you have the opportunity to be a part of something special! Our partner has rapidly expanded its business, achieving remarkable success in the field of life sciences. They are developing a cutting-edge life science product that will revolutionize the industry. Now, they are seeking a System Test Engineer to join their dedicated team of experts. If you are passionate about pushing boundaries and working with groundbreaking technology in the research field, this is the opportunity you've been waiting for.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Solna
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, on site
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Our partner continues their road to greatness and have quickly expanded their business to scale their success-story, developing a state-of-the-art life science product. You will be part of a hard-working organisation that every day gives their best to experiment and develop new-thinking technology within the research area. You will be instrumental in testing the new products and systems acting as the interface between the Software Team and the System Team.
 


  


 Through your work you will be of an important role to the start-up. You work in a cross-functional position where your detail-oriented and systematic approach is of great value to future development of the products and the organisation.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* To be a part of a company with the ambition the achieve great success
  
* Working closely with a senior colleagues with high level of competence
  
* A dedicated partnership with your Consultant Manager
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Defining and refining smoke tests of the software
  
* Defining regression testing for new software releases
  
* Writing test cases and test plans
  
* Executing tests, reporting bugs and writing test reports
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* MSc Technical biology, Molecular Biotechnology, Engineering Physics, Mechanical engineering or similar
  
* Work-life experience of system level testing, preferably of Life science instrumentation containing SW and HW
  
* Product development experience, preferably within the Life science space
  
* Experience from working hands on in labs or similar environment
  
* Strong proficiency in English, both verbally and in writing
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Previous experience of working system verification and validation
  
* Worked with test creation and execution planning in Jira
  
* Strong proficiency in Swedish, both verbally and in writing
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  


 We are looking for candidates that enjoy working in a goal-oriented environment and in projects with multi-functional teams involved. The right candidate is detail-oriented and values a systematic and structured way of working.
 


  


 It is important to have solid communication skills and a flexible mindset. To succeed in the role you have strong teamwork skills and an analytical and pragmatic approach. You are friendly, positive, and fun to work with and you enjoy working in a fast-paced and changing environment.
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Erik Gund or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth4@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15107146
